intro: Corchorus tirunelveliensis, commonly known as the Tirunelveli spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and alternate, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it holds ecological significance in its native environment.
